{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=DGN1000 |revision= |upc=606449066128 |ean= |asin=B0036R8FCO |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=09/21/2009 |manuf_country=China |manuf=SerComm |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id=PY309300114 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Infineon |cpu1_model=PSB 50601;AMAZON-SE (PSB 50601 HL V1.2); |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L3205DM2I-12G |fla1_num= |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM639165TS-6G |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9271 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8216 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=ADSL2+ |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=NETGEAR,NETGEARXX |default_ssid_regex=^NETGEAR$,,,^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=00:26:F2,30:46:9A,E0:91:F5,E0:46:9A |oui_eth=00:26:F2,30:46:9A,E0:91:F5,E0:46:9A |default_ch= }} '''Wireless-N 150 ADSL2+ Modem Router'''
{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=DGN1000|vs_id=12208}}
*OEM SerComm (YR600B-1.6)
See also [[Lantiq]] / [[Infineon]].
The FCC photos show the device with a USB port connected to a TerminusTech FE1.1 or FE2.1 USB hub IC, but real units seem to omit this.
Likely varying default SSIDs based on region / distribution.. *''NETGEAR'' is used *''NETGEARXX'' (''XX'' being a pre-assigned random number) is used
The power adapter included with the device is a ''NETGEAR'' MT12-Y120100-A1 (12V, 1.0A).
Some (earlier?) models have the same FCC ID but: * model number DGN1000SP * OUIs of E0:46:9A (may not be exclusive to spacious units though) * 32MiB RAM (EM63'''A'''165TS-6G) * 8MiB flash (MX25L'''6445E'''M2I-'''10G''') * "Ver. 1.3" on a sticker near the buttons (versus "Ver. 1.5" on less spacious DGN1000/DGN1000B units) * a large electrolytic capacitor between the power switch and the WiFi chip These are probably distributed by providers (certainly Orange in the UK).
